description.narrative:
Project Title: Towards a Fair Financing of Recovery in Tunisia and the MENA region The objective of the initiative is to shift the terms of the debate around debt and austerity policies shaping the pandemic response and recovery by fostering alternatives in the public debate in Tunisia and the MENA region. Thus, the project's outcome will be that "Civil society actors including feminist and environmental organizations are able to stir and influence public debate on debt and austerity in Tunisia and the MENA region" Withinthis initiative, Oxfam Tunisia will be responsible for: - Activity 2.1. Two meetings with the civil society coalition members to strategize and coordinate the implementation of the campaign. Oxfam will adopt an inclusive participatory approach and will make sureall relevant parties are involved during all the phases of the campaign’s implementation.
Governance: An informal Project Board will be established, where representatives from Oxfam Tunisia, and the Oxfam RP, as well as representatives from the coalition will sit and discuss about project strategy, updates on national and regional initiatives, synergies between the different interventions, risks, and some other operational aspects when needed. This can take place quarterly or when decided collectively. It will be facilitated by the Oxfam Tunisia.
Management: The work in Tunisia will be implemented, coordinated and monitored by country partners and Oxfam country team. They will be in charge of ensuring the completion ofactivities and delivery of outputs and outcomes at country level.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib registered in Tunisia in the end of 2011 and opened an office here early 2012. Oxfam#s work in the Maghreb is a multi country program comprising Morocco, Tunisia, Algeria and Libya. It supports local projects, is involved in lobby-work to take into account the interests of the poorest people, and campaigns to involve citizens in our work. It#s focus in the Maghreb is on social and political participation, gender justice and supporting sustainable livelihoods work. Four Oxfam affiliates work in the Maghreb:Oxfam Novib (The Netherlands), Intermon Oxfam (Spain), Oxfam Italy and Oxfam in Belgium. Oxfam has been working in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region for over five decades and over the past four decades promoting gender equality and supporting women#sright to participate and be represented in governance and decision-making structures and processes.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

description.narrative: Civil society organisations influencing financial and fiscal justice have strengthened their capacity
